attributes.action: Ban the production, sale and use of disposal BBQs
attributes.background: The government should ban the production, sale and use of disposable barbeques to prevent gorse fires which happen regularly throughout the spring and summer. Huge destruction is caused to nature and wildlife, and the fire services are stretched, putting lives in danger.
attributes.additional_details: With gorse fires a regular occurance, likely from the carelessness caused by members of the public, the risk to nature and the environment is irreplaceable. Disposal barbecues should be banned to prevent gorse fires from happening and destroying vast AONB like the Mourne Mountains. This is one example of destruction caused by a gorse fire. This has caused irreplaceable damage to the environment and puts the lives of people at risk due to the resources needed to manage these fires.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund replanting of trees lost to forest fires to help combat climate change
attributes.background: The Government should ensure there is sufficient funding and support to areas affected by the recent wildfires to allow sufficient trees to be replanted.
attributes.additional_details: It is important these areas are replenished to support local wildlife who may have been displaced or injured due to the ongoing wildfires. It is also important to offset global emissions produced by the United Kingdom and replanting forests can be a big part of a viable solution.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create a law that requires unnecessary lighting to be turned off
attributes.background: Create a law that requires lights in shop window displays to be turned off at 1am. Interior lights in offices and other non-residential buildings should be switched off an hour after the last employee leaves.
attributes.additional_details: The impact will be to save wasted energy and reduce the impact of light pollution in the country, all of which damages wildlife, humans and the environment.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Impose a corporation tax surcharge on companies that produce single-use plastics
attributes.background: Impose a corporation tax surcharge on companies that produce single-use plastics, based on the cost of removing plastic waste from the environment. The worst offenders would pay the highest surcharges, which would act as an incentive to change their behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: Every year billions of single-use plastic bottles and plastic packaging are bought across the UK, most ending up in landfill sites and in the oceans, causing damage to wildlife and resulting in microplastics that pollute the food chain. It can take upwards of 450 years for a single plastic bottle to degrade and so the problem is one that is going to affect future generations. It’s about time the Government took this problem seriously and showed they are serious about sustainability.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Ban non-biodegradable cling film to help the environment
attributes.background: Plastic cling film harms our environment. It should be banned from being sold by all retailers. Biodegradable cling film should be the only cling film available.
attributes.additional_details:
Cling film that cannot decompose harms our environment and furthermore, cling film that enters our shorelines and seas can be mistaken by fish and other marine wildlife as food which is harmful for them.
 
The Government should ban retailers from selling non-biodegradable cling film so that they are only able to sell cling film that is biodegradable, to help reduce damage to wildlife in our seas and in our countryside and valleys.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Help protect our environment by permanently banning unnecessary travel to work
attributes.background: The Government should require all workers to work from home unless they are unable to do so. People can be significantly healthier and happier working from home, and banning all unnecessary travel to work should benefit both the environment and our mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The coronavirus outbreak, and associated restrictions on movement, has resulted in large numbers of people working from home. This has allowed many to save money, catch up on sleep, and spend more time with their families.
 
Reduced activity, particularly commuting, resulting from coronavirus has had substantial environmental benefits. Air quality has improved dramatically in many areas, and much wildlife has been able to flourish.
 
This is the best time to make permanent changes and move forward.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Introduce legal requirement for annual licensing on each domestic cat ownership
attributes.background:
An annual renewable licence for each cat with the requirement to;
Microchip 
Owners to have responsibilities for damage to gardens and property caused by their cat.
Keep cats indoors at night (Curfew) 
Prosecution for damage to birds and nests (Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981)
attributes.additional_details:
Cats are destroying wildlife. Many species of bird have become almost extinct. Cats spread deadly disease. Toxoplasmosis can get into vegetables that grow in our gardens when cats defecate on the surrounding soil causing a lifetime incurable parasite that destroys the immune system and can cause death. 

Bring in the laws that they have in Australia such a licence and the requirement to keep cats indoors at night

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund bubble barriers in the Thames to stop plastic from reaching the ocean
attributes.background: A bubble barrier is a green solution that was found to stop 86% of plastic reaching the ocean during a recent test in the river IJessel in the Netherlands. It is said to be easy to install and very efficient. The Government should fund multiple bubble barriers for the Thames.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple bubble barriers in the Thames should stop most plastic from reaching the ocean, helping to preserve wildlife and the plastic that the bubble barrier stops could be collected and recycled.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Impose a levy on all plastic production in the UK
attributes.background: I want the Government to impose a levy on plastic production to cover the cost of tidying our land and sea of the unsightliness and dangers of plastic pollution. Our bodies, wildlife, waterways, towns and countryside are awash with non-recyclable, non-biodegradable plastic and plastic particles.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that plastics are not easily reusable or recyclable or biodegradable. A levy is needed to pay for the damage and mess of plastic pollution and incentivise producers to move to more sustainable practices. The amount imposed needs to be enough to mount a demonstrably effective and ongoing clean-up operation, and act as a financial disincentive to continued production.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban liquid plastic in cosmetics.
attributes.background: Microbeads have been banned. The same needs to happen to liquid plastic used in shampoo, soap, hand creams etc. This product cannot be filtered out so could be entering the food chain.
attributes.additional_details: This cannot be good for us, wildlife or the environment.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban garden and allotment fires.
attributes.background: It's not illegal to light bonfires/garden fires, and there are no national restrictions on when or how often they can be burned. The main concern is environmental damage especially as we are in a climate crisis, but it also affects air quality and wildlife.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Seek to improve the safety and ecological-soundness of pesticide use globally
attributes.background: I would like the Government to work internationally to seek to reduce and remedy use of harmful pesticides globally. Some pesticides can be bad for our health, the environment and economy - they affect wildlife and cause health issues. The UK and its partners can start to improve practices.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should work with other countries to put pesticide use on an ecological footing. This should include influence through trade deals, to agree world standards to create a healthier and more sustainable economy. Some pesticides increase the risks of cancers and foetal abnormalities. Crop pollinating is worth up to $600 billion globally and insects are important to our gardens and natural spaces. Our human needs are met by natural resources. We need others to accept this.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase punishments for illegal dumping of sewage in UK waters
attributes.background: The Government should create harsher punishments on those who illegally dump sewage in bodies of water in and around the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I live around the coast and know of the large verity of sea wildlife, not only that but much of the water around the UK is free for all to use. However some water companies have been illegally dumping sewage into the water and get insufficient backlash. I believe it is unfair to let this foul practice continue and should be stopped through harsher fines.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Parliament to have a vote on government review of protected species status.
attributes.background: Proposals in their required five yearly review to change the status of protected species under the Wildlife and Countryside Act (WCA) 1981 would reduce protection to only “in imminent danger of extinction”. Parliament must be given time to debate and vote on this damaging proposal.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has published documents about these proposed changes on an obscure website. It is hoping to make these changes, which would severely threaten many of the UK’s rare and endangered species, without proper parliamentary scrutiny.

This would enable developers, road building and rail construction such as HS2 to destroy vulnerable habitats without any accountability or challenge. What Boris Johnston called “the newt counting delays…” Parliament must hold this government to account.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Dogs that kill or maim any another animal should have to wear a muzzle in public
attributes.background: The number of poorly trained pet dogs in the UK seems to be spiralling out of control. If dogs have a history of violence, the owners should be required by law to muzzle their dogs in public. This is in order to protect the general public, the UK wildlife and other dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
On January the 24th 2021, I was walking with  in public land near Bath when a dog, a brown mutt with no owner in sight, pulled down a deer. After scaring away the bloody faced dog, we took the deer to a vet where it was put down. 

Any animal that is willing to do so much damage to another animal should be prevented from doing so in the future. Owners that fail to muzzle or control their dogs should be fined.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Put in place law restricting domestic cats from free-roaming
attributes.background: Free-roaming domestic cats let outdoors without supervision are exposed to many dangers, including diseases other cats may have, and they urinate and defecate in uncontrolled way and are a risk to wildlife such as rare birds.
attributes.additional_details:
Legislation should be introduced requiring cats to only be allowed outdoors under the supervision of the owner.

Free-roaming creates also a huge risk to cats themselves as across the country, they are shot, poisoned, and stolen. There are also cases of them being mutilated, drowned, beaten, set on fire, used in ritual sacrifice and used by dogfighters as “bait.” Cats can live happy lives indoors, and they can be given opportunities to explore the outdoors under supervision therefore, for the mutual benefits of the wildlife, cats and local societies, free-roaming must be legally restricted.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create new green planning requirements for residential properties
attributes.background: We want the planning system to be used to require developers of new housing to have to put in a net gain of trees, hedging, etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Developers should also be required to use hedging and trees to divide plots, and not fences or brickwork, supporting going green and wildlife.
 
Over the years housing developments have been built on greenfield sites, this has resulted in wildlife habitat being lost but also has resulted in loss of carbon capture via loss of trees, grass, etc.
 
The COP26 highlights the need for tree planting to reduce CO2 in the atmosphere one of the ways this could be achieved is by demanding housing developments provide green boundaries for plots, this should result in miles of hedging and trees being planted.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQs and campfires on moorland
attributes.background: Make the use of disposable BBQs and campfires illegal on moorland in order to avoid devastating wildfires. Marsden Moor is not alone in seeing a number of huge wildfires over the last three years caused by the use of disposable bbqs, firecrackers and campfires.
attributes.additional_details: Wildfires are one of the biggest threats to our Moorland. Climate change, irresponsible behaviour and the use of disposable bbqs have led to an increase in these distressing events. Firefighters and volunteers are being asked to risk their lives to battle these fires in terrifying conditions and local communities are seeing their environment being destroyed Our wildlife is being devastated. Nesting birds are being forced to abandon their eggs and mass habitat destruction is occurring.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the Use of Poison, Lethal Traps and Other Lethal Methods of Pest Control
attributes.background: Rats are very intelligent and usually social creatures. They are also capable of empathy for other rats. Foxes are vital native predators. Yet, these innocent creatures, along with many others, are wrongly and cruelly killed simply for existing, causing inconveniences and being in the wrong places.
attributes.additional_details:
Rat traps kill by crushing the necks of poor little rats, or by electrocuting them. 
 Glue traps are infamously evil, killing the poor animals slowly by suffocation or dehydration.
 Rat poisons are also extremely cruel, taking days to kill the poor rats by internal bleeding and turning their poor insides into a soup.
 Unwanted wildlife are also shot and otherwise killed. There are alternatives to killing wildlife to control them. Native and endangered animals are also at risk due to poisoning.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Go up not out and reuse existing buildings - ban all building on green space
attributes.background:
There must be no more using of green land for building.
Reuse existing buildings such as offices.
New build must be at least three storeys high  preferably more, with a communal garden.
attributes.additional_details:
Farmland and green spaces are being filled with housing at an alarming rate.
Whole areas are becoming unrecognisable and there is huge effect on wildlife and natural water control.
Building ever outwards is a luxury we can no longer afford. 
New build must be presumed to go up not out: like other countries with shortage of land we must start to build more homes on the same space with roof and community gardens.
The assumption that everyone will have a private garden can no longer be the case.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Use compulsory purchase to ensure safe access to a full Coastal Path route
attributes.background: Covid-19 and Brexit have highlighted the need to improve the mental and physical and economic health of the nation. GPs are encouraged to prescribe exercise instead of drugs.
attributes.additional_details:
Family holidays, walking, camping, wildlife, cycling, water sports and tourism would all benefit from a National Trail.
 
A round Britain walking path would increase access to healthy walking. It would be good for the physical and spiritual health of our people.
 
It would be good for tourism and the economy: camp sites, B&B businesses, restaurants and activity parks would spring up and thrive along the path.
 
More holidays would be taken in the UK. Less money would flow out of the country.
 
The path would become an National icon, a symbol of post Brexit United Kingdom.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Support Hospices and Wildlife rescue during COVID-19 pandemic
attributes.background:
During the COVID-19 pandemic hospices and wildlife rescues are at threat of closing as no incomes from their shops etc. 

They provide a vital service and at the best of times struggle to raise the necessary funds.
attributes.additional_details: Hospices and wildlife rescues provide crucial support on limited funds that they struggle to raise. This is an ongoing issue exacerbated since the pandemic, with their shops closing and sources of income and levels of volunteers being reduced due to the financial climate. Without hospices, families needing palliative support would be reliant on the NHS, already stretched beyond its limits. Without wildlife rescues continued care, a number of endangered native species could dramatically decline.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Require transformers and overhead cables be insulated & earthed to protect birds
attributes.background: Make it compulsory that all electricity transformers and overhead cables are plastic coated and earthed to make them wildlife friendly and help stop the deaths of birds.
attributes.additional_details:
Help make our countries' electricity equipment wildlife friendly.
 
The Barn Owl Trust have said that numerous birds are being electrocuted by coming into contact with uninsulated ‘droppers’ that connect each step-down transformer to the overhead 11,000 volt supply.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Fund a nationwide programme of tunnel building under main roads
attributes.background: Tunnels should be built under more roads such as motorways to allow wildlife to migrate around more freely. This needs to be done to reduce road traffic accidents and also reduce deaths to endangered species.
attributes.additional_details: If passageways and tunnels are built under more different types of roads then wildlife can migrate around more freely, saving the lives of both people and animals. Larger animals such as deer and other mammals can wander into busy roads causing fatal road accidents.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Enforce the Hunting Act 2004 & close loopholes that allow illegal Hunting
attributes.background: Enforce the Hunting Act 2004, close loopholes that allow illegal Hunting to occur
attributes.additional_details: Despite the Hunting ban being in effect since 2004, loopholes allow illegal Hunting to occur with hounds, the foxes are chased to exhaustion and ripped to pieces whilst alive by hounds. It's a barbaric and an outdated activity that happens despite it being banned. Enforce the ban and close the loopholes to stop allowing illegal Hunting of our wildlife to happen

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about hunting, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling for trail hunting to be banned, but you would need to provide your full name.

Enforcement of bans on hunting is a matter for the police, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Mini’s law - Protect the public and animals from hunting activities: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584076

Ban trail hunts from using more than two hounds: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583761

All Trail Hunt Hounds to be muzzled when released from kennels to public areas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565516

attributes.action: Increase VAT tax on products that utilize or contain plastic.
attributes.background: Increase the Tax on plastic containing products, whether its packaging or the product itself. Calculate the VAT tax to take into account a products percentage of plastic. Making products with higher amounts of plastic more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic is at this moment in time and incredibly cheap product however it is non biodegradable and often not disposed of correctly or recycled, resulting in it being found across the world causing problems for wildlife. increasing its cost would make non-plastic products the cheaper alternative and push the general public to use those products, reducing the plastic waste problem in the UK. Whilst also for a time generate extra income for the Government.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Stop the killing of all our wildlife in UK and ireland
attributes.background: I want the government to stop the killing of foxes elephants tigers sharks and many more wee need change and we need this change now
attributes.additional_details: I'm a naturelest and there people killing our wildlife it's not acceptable and if nothing is done there will be no change some of our animals will be extinct if we don't do something about this

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's already illegal to kill most of the animals mentioned in the petition. It is legal to shoot foxes under specific circumstances:

https://www.gov.uk/hunting/mammals
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Hedgehogs to be included in schedule 5 of the wildlife and countryside act
attributes.background: At present, Hedgehogs are at risk of extinction by 2025, we cannot stop this if they are not protected.
attributes.additional_details: In August 2016 DEFRA did not want to grant hedgehogs protected status as they apparently did not need protection from humans, but they do need protection from our behaviour. They are constantly being pushed out of their habitats as County Ecologists will only consider protected species when dealing with planning applications. There were 30 million in the 1970s its now less than 1 million, its time to stop watching the decline and state the obvious – they are endangered and should be protected.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300100

attributes.action: Ban the release of helium balloons into the environment
attributes.background: Stop organisations from selling helium balloons and swap to environmentally friendly ones
attributes.additional_details: It is not good for the environment and harms animals and local wildlife, eventually the balloons end up in the oceans as microplastics

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure if you want the Government to ban the release or sale of helium balloons, or both. It's also not clear what environmentally friendly alternatives you would prefer were sold and released.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Restrict the dates/days and times fireworks can be used.
attributes.background:
Restrict the private use of ‘loud’ fireworks to 3 days before or after 5th November and 31st December unless a licence is obtained.
Restrict fireworks after 11PM with the exception of New Year’s Eve when no fireworks should be set off after 1AM on 1st January.
attributes.additional_details:
I’d like this restriction for the following reasons:
- Fireworks can cause great distress to animals and the elderly. 
- Fireworks are often used by drug dealers to advertise the availability of new stock.
- Fireworks create pollution and the tenements are a danger to property and wildlife.
- Fireworks are more likely to be abused by children/teens if they have a larger window of opportunity to use them.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban use of fireworks by the public after 11pm, and organised displays after 1am: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626726

Restrict the sale and use of fireworks by the public to certain celebration days: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626787

Prevent the sale of Fireworks until the week of Bonfire Night and New Years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626600

attributes.action: Restrict or ban the sale of fireworks to the general public
attributes.background: To reconsider the sale of fireworks to the general public due to impact on wildlife and pets, noise pollution, climate issues and irresponsible use
attributes.additional_details: The impact on the above issues are huge. There are no licenses or restrictions in place to monitor or ban the use of fireworks used by any member of the general public causing irresponsible use and the death of wildlife and pets

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban sale of fireworks to the public and limit sales to licensed displays only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616868

Require a licence to buy or release any fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626683

attributes.action: Ban fireworks that make a noise. Silent fireworks only by law.
attributes.background: No one needs to terrify animals and kill wildlife to enjoy fireworks.  So all fireworks should be silent.
attributes.additional_details: Ban fireworks that make noise.

rejection.details:
All fireworks make a noise, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Reduce the decibel limit on fireworks to 85 decibels, to reduce impact: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622900

attributes.action: Save penny fields
attributes.background: Penny fields was owned by the community and somehow North Somerset council have taken it over and they want to build 44 houses on the that means  that means the children of  clevedon  We'll not be able to play on there anymore and also there is and also there is wildlife there as well so please
attributes.additional_details: Could you please help us save this field failed for the future of the children they have barbecues on their football and because on their football and games the council took away the swings I'll took away the swings years ago And also with the wildlife as well This would be nice if we could keep it as it is there is also a public right away there too

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Abolish geoengineering in the U.K.
attributes.background: Many people in this country are deeply concerned about the impact that geoengineering is having on our wildlife and our weather system. Their are also negative implications for our health due to this sinister practice.
attributes.additional_details: There is no way that the Government can fully understand the long term impact of geoengineering. The Government also need to be open, honest and accountable as to why they are doing it and therefore responsible for any detriment caused to the wildlife, the weather system and our health.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what actions you'd like the Government or Parliament to prohibit.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reinstate Halstead Essex Police Station
attributes.background: Since the closure of the Halstead police station, there has been an increase in antisocial behaviour and it has come to light that our wildlife is now under attack and a duckling has died due to injuries caused.
attributes.additional_details: Reinstate the Halstead Town Police Station

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local police stations are a matter for the local police force, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Make Wildlife Shooting, Culling and ‘ Game ‘ Hunting Illegal.
attributes.background:
Myself and the British people are demanding that the shooting, culling and ‘ game’ hunting of our wildlife should be made illegal, therefore people who do so to face consequences. 

Statistics show that due to hunting, wildlife statistics are decreasing. Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Wildlife, such as, birds, foxes, badgers etc, are being hunted, trapped, culled, shot and and hunted by dogs. The Government have also licensed a mass shooting of Starlings, our wildlife plays a massive part in our society, each and every animal has a soul and a right to live, people are taking this license in to their own hands and killing our wildlife and getting away with it, all for profit and ‘sport’. 

The British public are collectively demanding that a law is imposed to make this illegal

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the killing of wildlife, but it's not clear whether you want all shooting of wildlife (including for the purposes of pest control for example) to be banned, for the right to shoot animals after they have been caught by dogs on a hunt to be banned, or for something else.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Ban the shooting of dogs': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598808

'Require all hounds involved in 'trail hunts' to be muzzled': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608828

'Review the euthanasia of animals in the UK and impose reporting requirements': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606922

attributes.action: The government should put rough sleepers as first priority for accommodation
attributes.background: The government  can't continue to take in so called asylum seekers & settling them in the UK. Local councils & the government should remove every single rough sleeper off the streets &  put them up in hotels. Army barracks or a hostel.  unfortunately they are left on the streets & forgotten about.
attributes.additional_details:
So called asylum seekers are also adding  to the population of the UK we have nearly 70 million 
people living here. Already. The local  councils are put under pressure to build more housing  everywhere  because of mass migration.This can't continue or we will lose countryside woodland and green belt  including  local parks.&  farm land. Wildlife animals will become extinct. They are already declining because their habitats are destroyed. On a daily basis.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588351

attributes.action: Ban loud banger fireworks
attributes.background: Put a ban on the loud banger fireworks. You can now buy no noise ones so still get the same look but without the Bang!
attributes.additional_details: They not only scare the living daylights out of our beloved pets but also affect the wildlife and any ex or current service personnel suffering with PTSD.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make fireworks quieter: Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590838

Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

attributes.action: Make the sale of fireworks for licensed displays only. And make them silent.
attributes.background: Make it law that fireworks can only be seen, not heard, and at licensed displays only. There is the capability to make them silent, so make it obligatory that all fireworks sold or entering the UK are silent. Please stop the sale of fireworks to the public. Licensed displays only.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks kill. Fireworks maim. The detritus from fireworks travels a long way. That detritus can also kill wildlife, pets and livestock. The noise can and does disorientate and terrify people, wildlife, pets and livestock. Veterans and other humans suffer with PTSD and fireworks can cause them extreme suffering. Bees get confused and don’t return to their hives. Birds panic in terror and die. Wild animals abandon their young and dens. Pets, livestock and wild animals ingest the debris and die.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Make fireworks illegal to buy, with the exception of public displays.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/591501

Or this one: 

Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

attributes.action: Stop the insane amount of construction on our green space at Hengrove Air field
attributes.background: the council to look at what Damage Being done to the environment, wildlife, to valuable green space.The whole of Bristol south uses as recreational ground. Including sports, fitness. Used by Olympic athletes, it's history goes back to WW2 Wessex flyers accompanied by spitfires on secret missions
attributes.additional_details: Thousand of voters will be affected by this insane plan. The council will not listen to the people the old air Field was used by the Wessex flyers. They were accompanied by spitfires in WW2 on secret  missions. The Germans tried to bomb it but the (old contemptables) held them off  The Airfield is part of our history it's being taken away without  a care in the world. if any thing should be erected on this air field it should be in recognition to the Wessex flyers.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local planning matters are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Prioritise brownfield development in law to protect our green belt and farmland: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575169

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed revisions to remove legal protections for endangered animals
attributes.background: Proposed revisions to the Wildlife & Countryside Act would only guarantee legal protection to critically endangered animals, removing protections for endangered, near threatened, or vulnerable animals - all of which could be at significant risk of extinction. These protections should stay in place.
attributes.additional_details: We are on the precipice of an ecological disaster and urgent positive action for conservation is needed. The only way we can ensure that species such as Hedgehogs and Red Squirrels will still be here for our grandchildren to see is to properly address the level of protection afforded to our native wildlife and “level up” how we treat the nations most-loved animals.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590509

attributes.action: Reduce speed limits to 30mph throughout the boundary of Dartmoor national park
attributes.background: Look at speed restrictions in rural areas like Dartmoor National park. The whole boundary of the nation park need to be a designated as a maximum 30mph zone. Including all road through grazing areas and villages
attributes.additional_details:
To many livestock and wildlife are killed daily by cars traveling at excess speed in the national park. Removing all nation speed limits within the park and making the whole
Park a maximum 30mph would save the lives of many livestock and wildlife including some with dwindling numbers like hedgehog

attributes.action: Make it a crime for developers to clear habitat prior planning permission
attributes.background: Make it a crime for developers to evade current laws protecting rare species and breeding wildlife. They clear land prior to asking for planning permission. So nothing for biodiversity officer to see as it is already dead.
attributes.additional_details: I just watched helpless while an area of wasteland, taken by nature for over 10 yrs was bulldozed to oblivion. A fox den with young Cubs, a good population of hedgehogs who would not have escaped. Hedges full of nests, nests, wildflowers. W rang police wildlife officer and Derbyshire wildlife biodiversity officer. By the time we got them it was too late. They were heartbroken and say it happens all the time. Netting is also an issue, destroying swallows nests, bat roosts. All to avoid inspection.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580301

attributes.action: Make all operations in the countryside accountable to wildlife legislation
attributes.background:
Many operations in the countryside are accountable to the Wildlife and countryside act, or similar regulations.
Developers need to prove that they have taken measures to protect wildlife by law but the same accountability does not seem to apply to other operations ie forestry/agriculture.
attributes.additional_details:
A response to a recent enquiry into forestry operations by a company made very apparent that safeguards to follow wildlife legislation were not followed.
Forestry/agriculture/film locations etc can impact wildlife, often protected wildlife. Evidence must be given that they have taken measures to prevent this. Wildlife law accounts to all, it is not a wish list. If any operation has the potential to impact wildlife, ecological surveys/mitigation must be proven to Natural England.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  It's already the case that people, including developers, need to follow the law. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as creating new laws or establishing new enforcement.

attributes.action: STOP Heathy Mill, Offmore & Comberton 1400 housing estate development
attributes.background: It has come to light a beautiful part of our countryside is due to be made into a dwelling with 1400 homes. This is heartbreaking as it is home to so much wildlife and a popular route for walkers. It also means local farmers would be forced to relocate.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for your local authority, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://www.wyreforestdc.gov.uk/your-council/councillors-committees-and-meetings/constitution/section-21-wyre-forest-district-council-petition-scheme/

attributes.action: Strengthen laws protecting seals
attributes.background: To introduce legal protection of seals in a similar manner to already protected wildlife, such as the deer in Richmond Park.
attributes.additional_details: Seal sightings are increasing across the country and this has led to more frequent, and sometimes deadly, interactions with the public and their pets. It is important to urgently assess the need for further legislative protection for seals to encourage the peaceful coexistence between the general public and wildlife.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing protections for seals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already a number of legal protections for seals, which you can find out about here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/protected-marine-species/seals

attributes.action: Heavier fines and penalties for Littering
attributes.background: Make the penalties greater give local councils the authority to fine guilty parties. Make it acceptable to be a whistle blower and even a possible reward in doing so with use of photographic evidence etc. Give out comunity service orders to those that can’t or unable to pay
attributes.additional_details:
This is an ever growing problem for us all. That small persentage of people that  feel it's acceptable to drop litter need to be forced to change there ways.

The damage it is causing to our beautiful environment and the killing of our precious wildlife. The huge costs to our councils for clearing up this litter. The money wasted could be well spent on other serious issues, road repairs for an example which we are all crying out for to be done, a continuous pain in our sides.
We all complained years ago when government made it compulsory to wear seat belts. Now you would dream of not wearing them. That additional deterrent makes the difference. 
Let's make them think is it really worth the risk.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's already possible for councils to fine people for littering. It would be a decision for councils whether they want to include a reward scheme for reporting littering.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do or you could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban private firework displays, unless silent, and to only allow public displays.
attributes.background: To legislate to only allow private firework displays that are silent & licenced and to only allow public displays on 2 days of the year (New Year's Eve & the nearest Saturday to Guy Fawkes Night) except by special licence. To protect nervous pets, wildlife and humans. Particularly humans with PTSD.
attributes.additional_details: 51% of UK adults own a pet. Over 22% of people (not counting those in institutions) aged 16 years and over screened positive for PTSD in 2014 according to the gov.uk website. Special licences for all other than the limited allowance would make organisers (private or public) more accountable and traceable. The applications would also generate income for the authorities.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Glue Traps and make the sale of them illegal
attributes.background:
Glue traps are used as a method of trapping animals this results in an agonising, slow and painful death for the creature who has been caught.
These traps are laid down to catch vermin however wildlife also get caught in these traps and die this agonising cruel death.
attributes.additional_details: To ban the sale of Glue Traps and the non drying adhesive that is used to create them also make it illegal to use glue traps and glue boards
